summary: This bill, the "Freedom to Invest in Tomorrow’s Workforce Act," amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow qualified postsecondary credentialing expenses to be treated as qualified higher education expenses for 529 accounts. It defines "qualified postsecondary credentialing expenses" to include tuition, fees, books, and other related costs for programs leading to industry-recognized credentials. It also specifies what constitutes a "recognized postsecondary credential program" and a "recognized postsecondary credential," ensuring that these expenses are tax-advantaged.
